channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: New music Friday: Mitski's new album, 'Nothing's About to Happen to Me'
item.description: NPR's Ailsa Chang speaks with Raina Douris, host of World Cafe at member station WXPN, about Mitski's new album, Nothing's About to Happen to Me.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Ailsa Chang speaks with Raina Douris, host of World Cafe at member station WXPN, about Mitski's new album, Nothing's About to Happen to Me.
item.dc:creator: Michael Levitt

item.title: Populism is dominating politics right now
item.description: Republicans and Democrats are embracing their own takes on populism to respond to shifting politics in the country.
item.content:encoded: Republicans and Democrats are embracing their own takes on populism to respond to shifting politics in the country.
item.dc:creator: Domenico Montanaro

item.title: Australia says no to returning citizens with alleged ISIS ties from Syria
item.description: In Australia, the attempted return of people with alleged links to the Islamic State has raised questions about who bears responsibility for nationals who traveled overseas to join the Islamic State.
item.content:encoded: In Australia, the attempted return of people with alleged links to the Islamic State has raised questions about who bears responsibility for nationals who traveled overseas to join the Islamic State.
item.dc:creator: Kristina Kukolja

item.title: Why are Afghanistan and Pakistan fighting again?
item.description: Pakistan struck several sites in Afghanistan early Friday in what it calls an "open war." We look at what's driving the renewed fighting.
item.content:encoded: Pakistan struck several sites in Afghanistan early Friday in what it calls an "open war." We look at what's driving the renewed fighting.
item.dc:creator: Betsy Joles

item.title: Author Jennette McCurdy talks about her experience with eating disorder recovery
item.description: On Wild Card, well-known guests answer the kinds of questions we often think about but don't talk about. Author Jennette McCurdy talks about her experience with eating disorder recovery.
item.content:encoded: On Wild Card, well-known guests answer the kinds of questions we often think about but don't talk about. Author Jennette McCurdy talks about her experience with eating disorder recovery.

item.title: What happens to CNN if Paramount buys Warner Bros. Discovery?
item.description: The deal struck by Paramount to acquire CNN's parent company leaves a series of questions over the cable TV news giant. Journalists there are girding for what could be next if the deal is approved.
item.content:encoded: The deal struck by Paramount to acquire CNN's parent company leaves a series of questions over the cable TV news giant. Journalists there are girding for what could be next if the deal is approved.
item.dc:creator: David Folkenflik

item.title: Amid fraud concerns, Trump is rolling back a Biden rule aimed at stabilizing child care
item.description: In an effort to stabilize child care in America, the Biden administration changed how child care subsidies are paid. The Trump administration says the change invited fraud and is preparing a reversal.
item.content:encoded: In an effort to stabilize child care in America, the Biden administration changed how child care subsidies are paid. The Trump administration says the change invited fraud and is preparing a reversal.
item.dc:creator: Andrea Hsu

item.title: Colorado is making it a little easier to prove you exist
item.description: A woman born in Colorado has never had a birth certificate; her parents rejected such things. She's never gone to school, had a job or been on a plane. Revised rules mean she'll soon officially exist.
item.content:encoded: A woman born in Colorado has never had a birth certificate; her parents rejected such things. She's never gone to school, had a job or been on a plane. Revised rules mean she'll soon officially exist.
item.dc:creator: Dan Boyce

item.title: Hilary Duff explores the highs and lows of a 'sturdy' home life on new album
item.description: NPR's Juana Summers talks with Hilary Duff about her new album. It's called Luck... Or Something, and is her first release in more than 10 years.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Juana Summers talks with Hilary Duff about her new album. It's called Luck... Or Something, and is her first release in more than 10 years.
item.dc:creator: Juana Summers

item.title: Local 'All Things Considered' host Alex Chrichton signs off after 42 years at WXXI
item.description: WXXI News' Alex Crichton is retiring Friday, after 42 years at the station and hosting All Things Considered in Rochester, N.Y.
item.content:encoded: WXXI News' Alex Crichton is retiring Friday, after 42 years at the station and hosting All Things Considered in Rochester, N.Y.
item.dc:creator: Gabriel J. SÃ¡nchez
